item.title: Haiti Assassination Suspects Once Received U.S. Training, Pentagon Says
item.description: The accused, former Colombian soldiers, are among the thousands of troops from that country to have received U.S. military training.

item.title: China Prepares Team to Investigate Deadly Pakistan Bus Blast
item.description: The explosion, which killed at least nine Chinese citizens, has cast a shadow over Beijing’s mulitbillion-dollar investment program in Pakistan, an ally.

item.title: Lebanon's Prime Minister-Designate Hariri Resigns
item.description: The country’s political crisis deepens as Hariri says he couldn’t reach agreement with president and the economy craters.

item.title: Dozens Missing, at Least 40 Dead in Heavy Flooding Across Europe
item.description: The worst flooding in decades caused houses to collapse in Germany, Belgium and other parts of western Europe following days of heavy rain that swelled rivers and overloaded sewage systems.

item.title: Internet Powered Cuban Protests. The State Then Pulled the Plug.
item.description: The Communist-government shutdown of web and telephone services made it hard for Cubans to organize and get news of the demonstrations out across the country.

item.title: China to Walk a Fine Line After Growth in Second Quarter
item.description: Chinese policy makers are expected to seek a balance between supporting growth amid rising downside pressures and letting the economy run its course as they pivot to tackle longer-term challenges.

item.title: Top EU Court Sets Limits on Workplace Head-Scarf Ban
item.description: The court said that employers may ban the wearing of religious symbols but set out conditions on when such prohibitions comply with the bloc’s antidiscrimination laws.

item.title: Cannes, Risking China's Ire, to Screen Hong Kong Protest Documentary
item.description: The film festival’s decision to screen “Revolution of Our Times,” a documentary on Hong Kong’s 2019 pro-democracy protests that was produced in secret, comes as the city expands censorship.
